stories.title: Money Printing Elephant in the Room

stories.text: As we all know, there is a trend in the automotive industry towards ever more digital "features" in cars. Many of these software systems pose privacy risks; many others simply don't work as intended, leading to frustration and trips to the dealership. For those of us who are "old-school" and prefer their cars without fancy digital gimmicks, which cars would you recommend?
stories.title: Ask HN: Best cars without too much digitalization?

stories.text:
I see posts on HN with very talented people who can deep dive into very low level hardware/software so I'm wondering would it be possible to prevent thousands 2011-2014 27" iMacs from ending up in landfills by making target display mode work with newer USB-C [Thunderbolt 3 to thunderbolt 2 adapter](https://www.apple.com/ca/shop/product/MMEL2AM/A/thunderbolt-3-usb-c-to-thunderbolt-2-adapter)?

These were iMacs that had Thunderbolt ports instead of Displayports. I know there's already a way to do this with < 2011 iMacs.

Things I've already tried, but the experience is not great: - used NoMachine and dummy HDMI - Installed Monterey on the 2012 iMac and use it as an airplay receiver - used tools like [Deskreen](https://github.com/pavlobu/deskreen)
stories.title: Ask HN: Make Thunderbolt 3 to 2 target display mode work?
